meanings.definition: A sensation of whirling and loss of balance, associated particularly with looking down from a great height or caused by disease affecting the inner ear.
meanings.sent1: The vertigines I felt when I looked down from the tall tower made me dizzy.
meanings.sent2: She experienced vertigines when she peered over the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The vertigines from spinning in circles made the children giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His fear of heights gave him vertigines whenever he climbed a ladder.
meanings.sent5: The vertigines from the roller coaster ride lingered even after she got off.

meanings.definition: A giddy sensation of tilting within stable surroundings or of being in tilting or spinning surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The sudden vertigines made her feel like the room was spinning around her.
meanings.sent2: He experienced vertigines as if the ground beneath him was tilting.
meanings.sent3: The vertigines from the merry-go-round made him laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement caused vertigines that made her feel like she was floating.
meanings.sent5: The vertigines of the spinning top mesmerized the children at playtime.
